body:
<!--To help us understand and resolve your issue, please fill out the form to the best of your ability. Feel free to delete the sections that do not apply.-->

**Description of the problem**

The **-D+r** flag for histogram was broken by the themes merge.
<!-- Please be as detailed as you can when describing an issue. The more information we have, the easier it will be for us to track this down. -->

**Full script that generated the error**

```
gmt histogram  @v3206_06.txt -T599 -W0.25p -B -D+r -V -png plot
```

<!-- It helps a lot if you share any data files required to run your script. You can drag-and-drop them here or paste a link to Dropbox/GoogleDrive/etc. -->

**Full error message**

<!-- Tip: you'll get more detailed error messages if you add -Vd to your gmt commands. -->

```
histogram [INFORMATION]: Processing input table data
histogram [INFORMATION]: Reading Data Table from file /Users/meghanj/.gmt/cache/v3206_06.txt
histogram [INFORMATION]: 6521 points read
histogram [INFORMATION]: Extreme values of the data :	-5932	-24
histogram [INFORMATION]: Locations: L2, L1, LMS; Scales: L2, L1, LMS	-4387.89541481	-4717	-4906	906.38581019	581.1792	467.019
histogram [INFORMATION]: min/max values are :	-5932	-24	0	2522
histogram [INFORMATION]: Use w/e/s/n = -6000/-0/0/3000 and x-tick/y-tick = 1000/500
histogram [INFORMATION]: Linear projection implies y-axis distance exaggeration relative to the x-axis by a factor of 2
histogram [INFORMATION]: Map scale is 0.4 km per cm or 1:40000.
histogram [INFORMATION]: Area under histogram is 3.90608e+06
end [INFORMATION]: Process GMT figure queue: 1 figures found
end [INFORMATION]: Processing GMT figure #0 [plot png ]
psconvert [INFORMATION]: Processing /Users/meghanj/.gmt/sessions/gmt_session.16027/gmt_0.ps-...
psconvert [INFORMATION]: Find HiResBoundingBox ...
Error: /undefinedresult in --charpath--
Operand stack:
   (180)   0   (180)   true
Execution stack:
   %interp_exit   .runexec2   --nostringval--   --nostringval--   --nostringval--   2   %stopped_push   --nostringval--   --nostringval--   --nostringval--   false   1   %stopped_push   1990   1   3   %oparray_pop   1989   1   3   %oparray_pop   1977   1   3   %oparray_pop   1833   1   3   %oparray_pop   --nostringval--   %errorexec_pop   .runexec2   --nostringval--   --nostringval--   --nostringval--   2   %stopped_push   --nostringval--   --nostringval--   --nostringval--   --nostringval--
Dictionary stack:
   --dict:737/1123(ro)(G)--   --dict:0/20(G)--   --dict:75/200(L)--   --dict:157/250(L)--
Current allocation mode is local
Current file position is 21982
psconvert [ERROR]: System call [gs -q -dNOSAFER -dNOPAUSE -dBATCH -sDEVICE=bbox -DPSL_no_pagefill -dMaxBitmap=2147483647 -dUseFastColor=true '/Users/meghanj/.gmt/sessions/gmt_session.16027/gmt_0.ps-' 2> '/Users/meghanj/.gmt/sessions/gmt_session.16027/psconvert_31871c.bb'] returned error 256.
end [ERROR]: Failed to call psconvert
```


**Actual outcome**

No image

<!--The output produced by the above script, which may be a screenshot, console output, etc.-->

**Expected outcome**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14077947/112522374-ebb20500-8d73-11eb-81a7-75e5131804f9.png)

<!--A description of the expected outcome from the above script.-->

**System information**

* Operating system:
* GMT version (`gmt --version`):

comments_content.body:
So turns out -D struct has a font initialized to ANNOT_PRIMARY, which probably is NaN at this time.  THe PS shows all the calls to set up the font is passing a font size of 0, e.g. `0 F0 V 90 R (180) ml Z U`.  
Fixing it now.

title: histogram -D+r bug
